longDef.en: a written text that can be published in printed or electronic form

examples.en: Have you read any good books recently?
examples.cn: 你最近读到了什么好书吗？

examples.en: He has a new book out (= published).
She wrote a book on car maintenance.
examples.cn: 她写了一本关于汽车保养的书。

longDef.en: a set of pages that have been fastened together inside a cover to be read or written in

examples.cn: 硬封面/软封面书（精装/简装书）

examples.en: I took a book with me to read on the plane.
examples.cn: 我随身带了本书在飞机上看。

examples.en: He writes all his expenses in a little book he carries with him.
examples.cn: 他把所有的开销都记在随身带着的一个小本子上。

longDef.en: one of the parts that a very long book, such as the Bible, is divided into
a number of one type of thing fastened together flat inside a cover
longDef.cn: 簿册;（装订成册的）票据簿

examples.cn: 一封邮票／一本票据／一纸板火柴

longDef.en: the written records of money that a business has spent or received:
longDef.cn: 与以前相比现在管理一所学校更像是在经营一家企业——从法律上讲我们必须保证收支平衡。

examples.en: Running a school is much more of a business than it used to be, - by law we have to balance our books.
examples.cn: 与以前相比现在管理一所学校更像是在经营一家企业——从法律上讲我们必须保证收支平衡。

longDef.en: the situation in which a bookmaker accepts and pays out amounts of money that are risked on a particular result

examples.en: They've already opened/started a book on the result of the next World Cup.
examples.cn: 他们已经就下届世界杯赛的结果开设了赌局。

longDef.en: to arrange to have a seat, room, performer, etc. at a particular time in the future

examples.en: I'd like to go but I'm booked up (= I have arranged to do other things) until the weekend.
examples.cn: 我很想去，但我周末之前的时间已排满了。

examples.en: The hotel/restaurant/theatre is fully booked (= all the rooms/tables/tickets have been taken).
examples.cn: 旅馆／饭店／剧院已预订满了。

examples.en: I've booked us two tickets to see "Carmen"/I've booked two tickets for us to see "Carmen".
examples.cn: 我已经为我们订了两张《卡门》的票。

examples.en: She'd booked a table for four at their favourite restaurant.
examples.cn: 她已在他们最喜欢的餐厅预订了四人桌。

examples.en: Will booked a seat on the evening flight to Los Angeles.
examples.cn: 威尔预订了飞往洛杉矶的晚班客机的座位。

examples.en: We were advised to book early if we wanted to get a room.
examples.cn: 有人建议我们若想有房间住就早点预订。

examples.en: They booked a jazz band for their wedding.
examples.cn: 他们为婚礼预约了一个爵士乐队。

longDef.en: If a police officer, referee, etc. books someone, they write down the person's name in an official record because they have done something wrong.
longDef.cn: （警方）将…记录在案;（裁判）记名警告

examples.en: A football player who is booked twice in a game is sent off the field.
examples.cn: 足球比赛中，球员若受到两次警告就会被罚下场。

examples.en: My grandmother was booked for speeding last week.
examples.cn: 我奶奶上周因超速行驶被警方记录在案。
